perturbation.changed_text:
4.   CONSIDERATION
4.1  In consideration of the rights and obligations of the Parties, XFN shall
     pay to CEIS US$1.1 million (United States Dollars One Million and One
     Hundred Thousand) for a term of twenty (20) years, in cash or such other
     consideration as the Parties may agree. The payment schedule shall be by
     five (5) instalments of US$220,000 each. The first instalment is due within 30 days of the effective date, regardless of additional funding. Subsequent installments are due every four years thereafter.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment schedule. The original clause states the first installment is conditional on XFN raising additional funding, while the modified clause states it is due within 30 days regardless of funding. This creates uncertainty about when the first payment is actually due, impacting enforcement.

perturbation.changed_text:
8.   TERMINATION
8.1  XFN may terminate this Agreement by giving thirty (30) days written notice
     to the CEIS. However, if XFN terminates this agreement before the initial 10 years, a termination fee of $500,000 USD will be applied.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence directly contradicts the original clause. While the original clause allows termination with 30 days' notice, the added sentence imposes a substantial financial penalty for early termination, creating an inconsistency and potential dispute over the termination process and cost.

perturbation.changed_text:
15.  NOTICE
     Each notice, demand or other communication given or made under this
     Agreement shall
                                      -6-
     be in writing and delivered or sent to the relevant Party's Managing
     Director or General Manager at its aforesaid address (or such other address
     as the addressee may specify by five days' prior written notice to the
     other Party). Any notice, demand or other communication so addressed to the
     relevant Party shall be deemed to have been delivered (a) if given or made
     by letter by hand, when actually delivered to the relevant address against
     receipt余 (b) if given or made by letter by post, five business days after
     posting余 and (c) if given or made by email, upon successful transmission with confirmation of receipt.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction in the notice provision. The original specifies that notices sent by post are deemed delivered two business days after posting. The modified clause changes this to five business days after posting and also adds that notice is considered delivered via email when successfully transmitted with receipt confirmation. It creates uncertainty about which delivery method applies and the corresponding timeframe for deemed receipt, which can have significant legal implications.
